candidates.title: Spend-before-Sync release candidates
candidates.body: Closes #860.

candidates.title: Test refactorings in preparation for #907
candidates.body: Review this commit-by-commit, or with whitespace changes ignored.

candidates.title: zcash_client_backend: Add account birthday management to the Data Access API
candidates.body: Closes #897.

candidates.title: zcash_client_sqlite: Ensure that re-adding the same checkpoint information does not cause a database conflict.
candidates.body: The `add_checkpoint` method is intended to be idempotent. In the case that we add a checkpoint at an already-checkpointed block height, we should only raise an error in the case that the note commitment tree position or the set of notes spent in the checkpointed block has changed.

candidates.title: Pin `time` dependency to avoid forced MSRV bump.
zcash_client_sqlite: Build subtrees from new commitments in a threadpool
candidates.body:
The new `multicore` feature flag can be used to disable this behaviour.

Depends on https://github.com/zcash/incrementalmerkletree/pull/88.

candidates.title: Bump patched dependencies to bring in shardtree bugfixes
Replace `directories` dependency with `home, known-folders, xdg`
candidates.body: `directories 5.0.1` added a dependency on `option-ext`, which is licensed as MPL (a copyleft license), and which upstream intends to keep (dirs-dev/dirs-sys-rs#21). The replacement dependencies are all licensed as `MIT OR Apache-2.0`.

candidates.title: [Impacts API versioning] Update dependencies to resolve RUSTSEC-2022-0090
candidates.body:
This resolves [RUSTSEC-2022-0090](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2022-0090), and with both this patch and after I remembered to also run `cargo update`, there are now no `cargo audit` reports.

Note that this updates dependencies that are re-exported in the public interface, so I'm not super clear on if that's invasive for dependent crates or not. If it were invasive, it may imply something about our release versioning and semver, which I haven't thought about too carefully.

candidates.title: Use `rusqlite::Connection::prepare_cached` instead of manual statement caching.
candidates.body:
`rusqlite` includes a mechanism for creating prepared statements that
automatically caches them and reuses the caches when possible. This
means that it's unnecessary for us to do our own caching, and also
offers a minor performance improvement in that we don't need to eagerly
prepare statements that we may not execute in the lifetime of a given
`WalletDb` object. It also improves code locality, because the prepared
statements are now adjacent in the code to the parameter assignment
blocks that correspond to those statements.

This also updates a number of `put_x` methods to use sqlite upsert
functionality via the `ON CONFLICT` clause, instead of having to perform
separate inserts and updates.

candidates.title: Release zcash_address 0.3.0, zcash_primitives 0.12.0 and zcash_proofs 0.12.0

Requires https://github.com/zcash/orchard/pull/396

Fixes #850

candidates.title: Return the empty memo when memo is not present.
candidates.body:
Memos may be absent for both sent and received notes in cases where only compact block information has been used to populate the wallet database. This fixes a potential crash in the case that we attempt to decode a SQLite `NULL` as a byte array.

Fixes #384

(cherry picked from commit d99b4d4d6ec1126447159ffe649a3edac2f322d5)

candidates.title: Bump MSRV for `zcash_primitives` and dependents to 1.65
candidates.body: This corresponds to an MSRV of `n - 4`, in terms of previous analysis from #759.

candidates.title: zcash_history: Migrate to `primitive-types 0.12`
candidates.body: We also disable the default `std` feature, to remove transitive dependencies we don't use.

candidates.title: Pin winnow dependency to avoid MRSV break.
Migrations & data storage for pre-DAG-sync

This is resolves one of multiple audit failures reported in #816

candidates.title: Use proptest instead of quickcheck for zcash_history tests.
candidates.body:
Part of #757; resolves duplicate `rand-core` dependencies.

Best viewed ignoring whitespace changes.

candidates.title: zcash_primitives: Downgrade to `bip0039 0.10`
candidates.body: `bip0039 0.11` switched from language function arguments to a generic parameter. We aren't ready to migrate to this yet.

candidates.title: Upgrade to redjubjub 0.7.0
candidates.body:
This removes our reliance on the following out-of-date transitive dependencies that are duplicative of more recent versions of crates we depend on:
- bls12_381 v0.7
- ff v0.12
- group v0.12
- jubjub v0.9
- pasta_curves v0.4
- reddsa v0.3

candidates.title: zcash_note_encryption: remove `recipient` parameter from `Domain::note_plaintext_bytes`
candidates.body: This then updates the `zcash_note_encryption` crate for a version 0.3.0 release.

candidates.title: Update dependencies to reflect changes in ff 0.13
Temporarily re-expose ability to construct invalid Sapling bundles
candidates.body: Until zcash/zcash#6397 is closed, this ability is needed by `zcashd` for crossing the FFI.
